meanings.sent1: The evidence presented in court vindicates the accused man.
meanings.sent2: The DNA test vindicates the suspect and proves his innocence.
meanings.sent3: The security footage vindicates the cat of stealing the cookies.
meanings.sent4: Her alibi vindicates her, like a shining beacon of truth.
meanings.sent5: The witness's testimony vindicates the defendant beyond any doubt.

meanings.definition: Show or prove to be right, reasonable, or justified.
meanings.sent1: His hard work vindicates his promotion to manager.
meanings.sent2: The success of the project vindicates our decision to invest in it.
meanings.sent3: The happy ending of the movie vindicates the long wait in line.
meanings.sent4: The victory vindicates all the effort put into training for the race.
meanings.sent5: The data vindicates the scientist's theory, confirming its accuracy.
